instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> low voltage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi everybody

I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, its have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 2V. When i checked voltage <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> is 2V so <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> cant create <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. ( When i inject 12.8 V <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line machine is working )

Replaced 3 times <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> ,<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> ( same time replaced) . I cant find ISL6259AHRTZ datasheet for understand how is <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> creating, any idea about problem.

Thanks.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> low voltage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>CHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CHGR_RTS_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> voltage and report values....

threads.title: <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> low voltage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> low voltage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Check sense resistors <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52 and traces. If OK then remove F7040 and check again.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> low voltage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: When measure <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52 its shows correct value. removed f7040 nothing changed. But problem interesting  5 seccond <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 14Volt and down 2Volt for 5-7 second then again 14V  up down up down:)

threads.title: <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> low voltage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: All my fucked up 2850s do that. What happens if you short the pins of the SMC data line talking to the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> together with a solder blob or tweezers momentarily, do you get 12.23v steady or still jumping?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> low voltage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes Louis when i put jumper <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 10-11 pins <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is ok ( first 13V then 11.9V ) machine starts. But i think cant see or charge battery? What is your suggestion? I have to Replace SMC?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> low voltage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: When i changed 2 times SMC nothing change:( <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage is low machine cannot turn on and battery is not charging. Any idea for next step?
